Hi, I have a few questions and hope to get them answered here. The situation is that we want to launch a NFT contract (either ERC-721 or ERC-1155) and we want to keep the gas costs as small as possible. This is why we are considering using Polygon/Matic. We aim to use the PoS Bridge to allow the users to exit to Ethereum.

Now my questions:
- The Main or Root NFT Contract must be deployed on Ethereum and mapped to a Child Contract on Matic, right?
- How can we achieve as little as possible transactions on Ethereum? Or better said => how much transactions are necessary for us to perform on Ethereum in order to enable the Child Contract to manage all of or logic (including minting or other possibly custom logic)?
- Can we just deploy the Root Contract on Ethereum without minting anything and perform all minting related actions on Matic after mapping the Child Contract?
In best case we would completely omit transactions on Ethereum and map the contracts later on. Would that also be possible?
